thag7.2:5.1: Bhaddiya has plucked out craving, root and all,
thag7.2:5.3: on the far side of the Wild Mango Monastery,
thag7.2:5.4: he practices absorption; he is truly well-favoured.
thag7.2:6.2: in arched harps, and in cymbals.
thag7.2:6.3: But here, at the foot of a tree,
thag7.2:6.4: I delight in the Buddha’s teaching.
thag7.2:7.1: If the Buddha were to grant me one wish,
thag7.2:7.2: and I were to get what I wished for,
thag7.2:7.3: I’d choose for the whole world
thag7.2:8.1: Those who’ve judged me on appearance,
thag7.2:8.2: and those swayed by my voice,
thag7.2:8.3: are full of desire and greed;
thag7.2:9.3: the fool shut in on every side,
thag7.2:9.4: gets carried away by a voice.
thag7.2:10.4: they’re also carried away by a voice.
thag7.2:11.4: they don’t get carried away by a voice.
